libraries.name: Accumulators
libraries.description: Framework for incremental calculation, and collection of statistical accumulators.

libraries.name: Algorithm
libraries.description: A collection of useful generic algorithms.

libraries.name: Align
libraries.description: Memory alignment functions, allocators, traits.

libraries.name: Any
libraries.description: Safe, generic container for single values of different value types.

libraries.name: Array
libraries.description: STL compliant container wrapper for arrays of constant size.

libraries.name: Asio
libraries.description: Portable networking and other low-level I/O, including sockets, timers, hostname resolution, socket iostreams, serial ports, file descriptors and Windows HANDLEs.

libraries.name: Assert
libraries.description: Customizable assert macros.

libraries.name: Assign
libraries.description: Filling containers with constant or generated data has never been easier.

libraries.name: Atomic
libraries.description: C++11-style atomic types.

libraries.name: Beast
libraries.description: Portable HTTP, WebSocket, and network operations using only C++11 and Boost.Asio

libraries.name: Bimap
libraries.description: Bidirectional maps library for C++. With Boost.Bimap you can create associative containers in which both types can be used as key.

libraries.name: Bind
libraries.description: boost::bind is a generalization of the standard functions std::bind1st and std::bind2nd. It supports arbitrary function objects, functions, function pointers, and member function pointers, and is able to bind any argument to a specific value or route input arguments into arbitrary positions.

libraries.name: Bloom
libraries.description: Bloom filters.

libraries.name: CallableTraits
libraries.description: A spiritual successor to Boost.FunctionTypes, Boost.CallableTraits is a header-only C++11 library for the compile-time inspection and manipulation of all 'callable' types. Additional support for C++17 features.

libraries.name: Call Traits
libraries.description: Defines types for passing parameters.

libraries.name: CharConv
libraries.description: An implementation of <charconv> in C++11.

libraries.name: Chrono
libraries.description: Useful time utilities. C++11.

libraries.name: Circular Buffer
libraries.description: A STL compliant container also known as ring or cyclic buffer.

libraries.name: Cobalt
libraries.description: Coroutines. Basic Algorithms & Types

libraries.name: Compat
libraries.description: C++11 implementations of standard components added in later C++ standards.

libraries.name: Compressed Pair
libraries.description: A pair class with empty member optimization.

libraries.name: Compute
libraries.description: Parallel/GPU-computing library

libraries.name: Concept Check
libraries.description: Tools for generic programming.

libraries.name: Config
libraries.description: Helps Boost library developers adapt to compiler idiosyncrasies; not intended for library users.

libraries.name: Container
libraries.description: Standard library containers and extensions.

libraries.name: Container Hash
libraries.description: An STL-compatible hash function object that can be extended to hash user defined types.

libraries.name: Context
libraries.description: (C++11) Context switching library.

libraries.name: Contract
libraries.description: Contract programming for C++. All contract programming features are supported: Subcontracting, class invariants, postconditions (with old and return values), preconditions, customizable actions on assertion failure (e.g., terminate or throw), optional compilation and checking of assertions, etc.

libraries.name: Conversion
libraries.description: Polymorphic casts.

libraries.name: Convert
libraries.description: An extendible and configurable type-conversion framework.

libraries.name: Core
libraries.description: A collection of simple core utilities with minimal dependencies.

libraries.name: Coroutine
libraries.description: Coroutine library.

libraries.name: Coroutine2
libraries.description: (C++11) Coroutine library.

libraries.name: CRC
libraries.description: The Boost CRC Library provides two implementations of CRC (cyclic redundancy code) computation objects and two implementations of CRC computation functions. The implementations are template-based.

libraries.name: Date Time
libraries.description: A set of date-time libraries based on generic programming concepts.

libraries.name: Describe
libraries.description: A C++14 reflection library.

libraries.name: Detail
libraries.description: This library contains a set of header only utilities used internally by Boost C++ Libraries to facilitate their implementation.

libraries.name: DLL
libraries.description: Library for comfortable work with DLL and DSO.

libraries.name: Dynamic Bitset
libraries.description: The dynamic_bitset template represents a set of bits. It provides access to the value of individual bits via operator[] and provides all of the bitwise operators that one can apply to builtin integers, such as operator& and operator<<. The number of bits in the set can change at runtime.

libraries.name: Enable If
libraries.description: Selective inclusion of function template overloads.

libraries.name: Endian
libraries.description: Types and conversion functions for correct byte ordering and more regardless of processor endianness.

libraries.name: Exception
libraries.description: The Boost Exception library supports transporting of arbitrary data in exception objects, and transporting of exceptions between threads.

libraries.name: Fiber
libraries.description: (C++11) Userland threads library.

libraries.name: Filesystem
libraries.description: The Boost Filesystem Library provides portable facilities to query and manipulate paths, files, and directories.

libraries.name: Flyweight
libraries.description: Design pattern to manage large quantities of highly redundant objects.

libraries.name: Foreach
libraries.description: In C++, writing a loop that iterates over a sequence is tedious. We can either use iterators, which requires a considerable amount of boiler-plate, or we can use the std::for_each() algorithm and move our loop body into a predicate, which requires no less boiler-plate and forces us to move our logic far from where it will be used. In contrast, some other languages, like Perl, provide a dedicated "foreach" construct that automates this process. BOOST_FOREACH is just such a construct for C++. It iterates over sequences for us, freeing us from having to deal directly with iterators or write predicates.

libraries.name: Format
libraries.description: The format library provides a type-safe mechanism for formatting arguments according to a printf-like format-string.

libraries.name: Function
libraries.description: Function object wrappers for deferred calls or callbacks.

libraries.name: Functional
libraries.description: The Boost.Function library contains a family of class templates that are function object wrappers.

libraries.name: Functional/Factory
libraries.description: Function object templates for dynamic and static object creation

libraries.name: Functional/Forward
libraries.description: Adapters to allow generic function objects to accept arbitrary arguments

libraries.name: Functional/Overloaded Function
libraries.description: Overload different functions into a single function object.

libraries.name: Function Types
libraries.description: Boost.FunctionTypes provides functionality to classify, decompose and synthesize function, function pointer, function reference and pointer to member types.

libraries.name: Fusion
libraries.description: Library for working with tuples, including various containers, algorithms, etc.

libraries.name: Geometry
libraries.description: The Boost.Geometry library provides geometric algorithms, primitives and spatial index.

libraries.name: GIL
libraries.description: (C++14) Generic Image Library

libraries.name: Graph
libraries.description: The BGL graph interface and graph components are generic, in the same sense as the Standard Template Library (STL).

libraries.name: GraphParallel
libraries.description: The PBGL graph interface and graph components are generic, in the same sense as the Standard Template Library (STL).

libraries.name: Hana
libraries.description: A modern C++ metaprogramming library. It provides high level algorithms to manipulate heterogeneous sequences, allows writing type-level computations with a natural syntax, provides tools to introspect user-defined types and much more.

libraries.name: Hash2
libraries.description: An extensible hashing framework.

libraries.name: Heap
libraries.description: Priority queue data structures.

libraries.name: Histogram
libraries.description: Fast multi-dimensional histogram with convenient interface for C++14

libraries.name: HOF
libraries.description: Higher-order functions for C++

libraries.name: ICL
libraries.description: Interval Container Library, interval sets and maps and aggregation of associated values

libraries.name: Identity Type
libraries.description: Wrap types within round parenthesis so they can always be passed as macro parameters.

libraries.name: In Place Factory, Typed In Place Factory
libraries.description: Generic in-place construction of contained objects with a variadic argument-list.

libraries.name: Integer
libraries.description: The organization of boost integer headers and classes is designed to take advantage of <stdint.h> types from the 1999 C standard without resorting to undefined behavior in terms of the 1998 C++ standard. The header <boost/cstdint.hpp> makes the standard integer types safely available in namespace boost without placing any names in namespace std.

libraries.name: Interprocess
libraries.description: Shared memory, memory mapped files, process-shared mutexes, condition variables, containers and allocators.

libraries.name: Interval
libraries.description: Extends the usual arithmetic functions to mathematical intervals.

libraries.name: Intrusive
libraries.description: Intrusive containers and algorithms.

libraries.name: IO
libraries.description: Utilities for the standard I/O library.

libraries.name: Iostreams
libraries.description: Boost.IOStreams provides a framework for defining streams, stream buffers and i/o filters.

libraries.name: Iterator
libraries.description: The Boost Iterator Library contains two parts. The first is a system of concepts which extend the C++ standard iterator requirements. The second is a framework of components for building iterators based on these extended concepts and includes several useful iterator adaptors.

libraries.name: JSON
libraries.description: JSON parsing, serialization, and DOM in C++11

libraries.name: Lambda
libraries.description: Define small unnamed function objects at the actual call site, and more.

libraries.name: Lambda2
libraries.description: A C++14 lambda library.

libraries.name: LEAF
libraries.description: A lightweight error handling library for C++11.

libraries.name: Lexical Cast
libraries.description: General literal text conversions, such as an int represented a string, or vice-versa.

libraries.name: Locale
libraries.description: Provide localization and Unicode handling tools for C++.

libraries.name: Local Function
libraries.description: Program functions locally, within other functions, directly within the scope where they are needed.

libraries.name: Lockfree
libraries.description: Lockfree data structures.

libraries.name: Log
libraries.description: Logging library.

libraries.name: Math
libraries.description: Boost.Math includes several contributions in the domain of mathematics: Floating Point Utilities, Specific Width Floating Point Types, Mathematical Constants, Statistical Distributions, Special Functions, Root Finding and Function Minimization, Polynomials and Rational Functions, Interpolation, and Numerical Integration and Differentiation. Many of these features are templated to support both built-in, and extended width types (e.g. Boost.Multiprecision)

libraries.name: Member Function
libraries.description: Generalized binders for function/object/pointers and member functions.

libraries.name: Metaparse
libraries.description: A library for generating compile time parsers parsing embedded DSL code as part of the C++ compilation process

libraries.name: Meta State Machine
libraries.description: A very high-performance library for expressive UML2 finite state machines.

libraries.name: Min-Max
libraries.description: Standard library extensions for simultaneous min/max and min/max element computations.

libraries.name: Move
libraries.description: Portable move semantics for C++03 and C++11 compilers.

libraries.name: Mp11
libraries.description: A C++11 metaprogramming library.

libraries.name: MPI
libraries.description: Message Passing Interface library, for use in distributed-memory parallel application programming.

libraries.name: MPL
libraries.description: The Boost.MPL library is a general-purpose, high-level C++ template metaprogramming framework of compile-time algorithms, sequences and metafunctions. It provides a conceptual foundation and an extensive set of powerful and coherent tools that make doing explict metaprogramming in C++ as easy and enjoyable as possible within the current language.

libraries.name: MQTT5
libraries.description: MQTT5 client library built on top of Boost.Asio.

libraries.name: Multi-Array
libraries.description: Boost.MultiArray provides a generic N-dimensional array concept definition and common implementations of that interface.

libraries.name: Multi-Index
libraries.description: The Boost Multi-index Containers Library provides a class template named multi_index_container which enables the construction of containers maintaining one or more indices with different sorting and access semantics.

libraries.name: Multiprecision
libraries.description: Extended precision arithmetic types for floating point, integer, and rational arithmetic.

libraries.name: MySQL
libraries.description: MySQL client library built on top of Boost.Asio.

libraries.name: Nowide
libraries.description: Standard library functions with UTF-8 API on Windows.

libraries.name: Numeric Conversion
libraries.description: Optimized Policy-based Numeric Conversions.

libraries.name: Odeint
libraries.description: Solving ordinary differential equations.

libraries.name: OpenMethod
libraries.description: Open-methods for C++17 and above.

libraries.name: Operators
libraries.description: Templates to simplify operator definition in arithmetic classes and iterators.

libraries.name: Optional
libraries.description: A value-semantic, type-safe wrapper for representing 'optional' (or 'nullable') objects of a given type. An optional object may or may not contain a value of the underlying type.

libraries.name: Outcome
libraries.description: A deterministic failure handling library partially simulating lightweight exceptions.

libraries.name: Parameter
libraries.description: Boost.Parameter Library - Write functions that accept arguments by name.

libraries.name: Parameter Python Bindings
libraries.description: Boost.Parameter Library Python bindings.

libraries.name: Parser
libraries.description: A parser combinator library.

libraries.name: PFR
libraries.description: Basic reflection  for user defined types.

libraries.name: Phoenix
libraries.description: Define small unnamed function objects at the actual call site, and more.

libraries.name: Pointer Container
libraries.description: Containers for storing heap-allocated polymorphic objects to ease OO-programming.

libraries.name: PolyCollection
libraries.description: Fast containers of polymorphic objects.

libraries.name: Polygon
libraries.description: Voronoi diagram construction and booleans/clipping, resizing/offsetting and more for planar polygons with integral coordinates.

libraries.name: Pool
libraries.description: Memory pool management.

libraries.name: Predef
libraries.description: This library defines a set of compiler, architecture, operating system, library, and other version numbers from the information it can gather of C, C++, Objective C, and Objective C++ predefined macros or those defined in generally available headers.

libraries.name: Preprocessor
libraries.description: Preprocessor metaprogramming tools including repetition and recursion.

libraries.name: Process
libraries.description: Library to create processes in a portable way.

libraries.name: Program Options
libraries.description: The program_options library allows program developers to obtain program options, that is (name, value) pairs from the user, via conventional methods such as command line and config file.

libraries.name: Property Map
libraries.description: Concepts defining interfaces which map key objects to value objects.

libraries.name: Property Map (Parallel)
libraries.description: Parallel extensions to Property Map for use with Parallel Graph.

libraries.name: Property Tree
libraries.description: A tree data structure especially suited to storing configuration data.

libraries.name: Proto
libraries.description: Expression template library and compiler construction toolkit for domain-specific embedded languages.

libraries.name: Python
libraries.description: The Boost Python Library is a framework for interfacing Python and C++. It allows you to quickly and seamlessly expose C++ classes functions and objects to Python, and vice-versa, using no special tools -- just your C++ compiler.

libraries.name: QVM
libraries.description: Generic C++ library for working with Quaternions Vectors and Matrices.

libraries.name: Random
libraries.description: A complete system for random number generation.

libraries.name: Range
libraries.description: A new infrastructure for generic algorithms that builds on top of the new iterator concepts.

libraries.name: Ratio
libraries.description: Compile time rational arithmetic. C++11.

libraries.name: Rational
libraries.description: A rational number class.

libraries.name: Redis
libraries.description: Redis async client library built on top of Boost.Asio.

libraries.name: Ref
libraries.description: A utility library for passing references to generic functions.

libraries.name: Regex
libraries.description: Regular expression library.

libraries.name: Result Of
libraries.description: Determines the type of a function call expression.

libraries.name: Safe Numerics
libraries.description: Guaranteed Correct Integer Arithmetic

libraries.name: Scope
libraries.description: A collection of scope guards and a unique_resource wrapper.

libraries.name: Scope Exit
libraries.description: Execute arbitrary code at scope exit.

libraries.name: Serialization
libraries.description: Serialization for persistence and marshalling.

libraries.name: Signals2
libraries.description: Managed signals & slots callback implementation (thread-safe version 2).

libraries.name: Smart Ptr
libraries.description: Smart pointer class templates.

libraries.name: Sort
libraries.description: High-performance templated sort functions.

libraries.name: Spirit
libraries.description: LL parser framework represents parsers directly as EBNF grammars in inlined C++.

libraries.name: Stacktrace
libraries.description: Gather, store, copy and print backtraces.

libraries.name: Statechart
libraries.description: Boost.Statechart - Arbitrarily complex finite state machines can be implemented in easily readable and maintainable C++ code.

libraries.name: Static Assert
libraries.description: Static assertions (compile time assertions).

libraries.name: Static String
libraries.description: A fixed capacity dynamically sized string.

libraries.name: Stl_interfaces
libraries.description: C++14 and later CRTP templates for defining iterators, views, and containers.

libraries.name: String Algo
libraries.description: String algorithms library.

libraries.name: String View
libraries.description: String view templates.

libraries.name: Swap
libraries.description: Enhanced generic swap function.

libraries.name: System
libraries.description: Extensible error reporting.

libraries.name: Test
libraries.description: Support for simple program testing, full unit testing, and for program execution monitoring.

libraries.name: Thread
libraries.description: Portable C++ multi-threading. C++11, C++14, C++17.

libraries.name: ThrowException
libraries.description: A common infrastructure for throwing exceptions from Boost libraries.

libraries.name: Timer
libraries.description: Event timer, progress timer, and progress display classes.

libraries.name: Tokenizer
libraries.description: Break of a string or other character sequence into a series of tokens.

libraries.name: Tribool
libraries.description: 3-state boolean type library.

libraries.name: TTI
libraries.description: Type Traits Introspection library.

libraries.name: Tuple
libraries.description: Ease definition of functions returning multiple values, and more.

libraries.name: Type Erasure
libraries.description: Runtime polymorphism based on concepts.

libraries.name: Type Index
libraries.description: Runtime/Compile time copyable type info.

libraries.name: Typeof
libraries.description: Typeof operator emulation.

libraries.name: Type Traits
libraries.description: Templates for fundamental properties of types.

libraries.name: uBLAS
libraries.description: uBLAS provides tensor, matrix, and vector classes as well as basic linear algebra routines. Several dense, packed and sparse storage schemes are supported.

libraries.name: Units
libraries.description: Zero-overhead dimensional analysis and unit/quantity manipulation and conversion.

libraries.name: Unordered
libraries.description: Unordered associative containers.

libraries.name: URL
libraries.description: URL parsing in C++11

libraries.name: Utility
libraries.description: Various utilities, such as base-from-member idiom and binary literals in C++03.

libraries.name: Uuid
libraries.description: A universally unique identifier.

libraries.name: Value Initialized
libraries.description: Wrapper for uniform-syntax value initialization, based on the original idea of David Abrahams.

libraries.name: Variant
libraries.description: Safe, generic, stack-based discriminated union container.

libraries.name: Variant2
libraries.description: A never-valueless, strong guarantee implementation of std::variant.

libraries.name: VMD
libraries.description: Variadic Macro Data library.

libraries.name: Wave
libraries.description: The Boost.Wave library is a Standards conformant, and highly configurable implementation of the mandated C99/C++ preprocessor functionality packed behind an easy to use iterator interface.

libraries.name: WinAPI
libraries.description: Windows API abstraction layer.

libraries.name: Xpressive
libraries.description: Regular expressions that can be written as strings or as expression templates, and which can refer to each other and themselves recursively with the power of context-free grammars.

libraries.name: YAP
libraries.description: An expression template library for C++14 and later.
